intro: Delphinium decorum, commonly known as the blue larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its tall, spindly stems that bear clusters of blue or violet flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. Delphinium decorum is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, which includes other notable plants like buttercups and anemones. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and wildflower displays.
